intro: Cremastosperma polyphlebum, commonly known as the broadleaf burrgrass, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Leguminosae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, while the seeds are enclosed in hairy, spiny pods. Cremastosperma polyphlebum is often used in traditional medicine and as a forage plant for livestock.
